title: How Ukraine War Enriches Uranium Miners
sub_head: Russia’s invasion is adding multiple sources of fuel to uranium’s rally
body:
Nuclear and weaponizing are scary words to utter together, even in the context of energy.
That fear is behind a rally in a key fuel not yet hit by a physical shortage. Prices of uranium oxide have soared to $57.50 per pound, levels last seen more than a decade ago before the Fukushima disaster turned global sentiment against nuclear energy. They are up more than a third since Russia’s invasion of Ukraine. Shares of Canadian uranium miner Cameco have rallied 29% year to date, while Sprott Physical Uranium Trust , a fund that owns physical uranium, is up 31%.
